        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $7500 for this report + $1000 bisect bonus. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $7500 for this report + $1000 bisect bonus. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

          New hotlist name:<label for="newHotlistName">New hotlist name:</label>

          <label for="newHotlistName">New hotlist name:</label>
          <input type="text" name="newHotlistName">
        </div>
        
      <br>

        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Feb 5, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">

      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>The root cause of this issue is similar to <span class="line"><!---->The root cause of this issue is similar to <!----></span>issue 1355718<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1355718" title="Security: UAF in hci_cmd_timeout "><!---->issue 1355718<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>race condition UAF.<span class="line"><!---->race condition UAF.<!----></span><br><br>*hci_cmd_sync_queue* will check the flag of hdev not equal to *HCI_UNREGISTER*[1], and enqueue *hdev->cmd_sync_work*(which is *hci_cmd_sync_work*)[2]. *hci_cmd_sync_work* will get entry[3] from *hdev->cmd_sync_work_list*, and remove it from *hdev->cmd_sync_work_list* under *hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock*. But *hci_cmd_sync_clear* get entry from *hdev->cmd_sync_work_list* and delete it[4] without any lock. There will be a race condition between *hci_cmd_sync_work* and *hci_cmd_sync_clear*.<span class="line"><!---->*hci_cmd_sync_queue* will check the flag of hdev not equal to *HCI_UNREGISTER*[1], and enqueue *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work*(which is *hci_cmd_sync_work*)[2]. *hci_cmd_sync_work* will get entry[3] from *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list*, and remove it from *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list* under *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock*. But *hci_cmd_sync_clear* get entry from *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list* and delete it[4] without any lock. There will be a race condition between *hci_cmd_sync_work* and *hci_cmd_sync_clear*.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>int hci_cmd_sync_queue(struct hci_dev *hdev, hci_cmd_sync_work_func_t func,<span class="line"><!---->int hci_cmd_sync_queue(struct hci_dev *hdev, hci_cmd_sync_work_func_t func,<!----></span><br>		       void *data, hci_cmd_sync_work_destroy_t destroy)<span class="line"><!---->		       void *data, hci_cmd_sync_work_destroy_t destroy)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<!----></span><br><br>	if (hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER))	// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER))	// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -ENODEV;<span class="line"><!---->		return -ENODEV;<!----></span><br><br>	entry = kmalloc(sizeof(*entry), GFP_KERNEL);<span class="line"><!---->	entry = kmalloc(sizeof(*entry), GFP_KERNEL);<!----></span><br>	if (!entry)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!entry)<!----></span><br>		return -ENOMEM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -ENOMEM;<!----></span><br><br>	entry->func = func;<span class="line"><!---->	entry-&gt;func = func;<!----></span><br>	entry->data = data;<span class="line"><!---->	entry-&gt;data = data;<!----></span><br>	entry->destroy = destroy;<span class="line"><!---->	entry-&gt;destroy = destroy;<!----></span><br><br>	mutex_lock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->	mutex_lock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br>	list_add_tail(&entry->list, &hdev->cmd_sync_work_list);<span class="line"><!---->	list_add_tail(&amp;entry-&gt;list, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list);<!----></span><br>	mutex_unlock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->	mutex_unlock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br><br>	queue_work(hdev->req_workqueue, &hdev->cmd_sync_work);	// [2]<span class="line"><!---->	queue_work(hdev-&gt;req_workqueue, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work);	// [2]<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>static void hci_cmd_sync_work(struct work_struct *work)<span class="line"><!---->static void hci_cmd_sync_work(struct work_struct *work)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev, cmd_sync_work);<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev, cmd_sync_work);<!----></span><br><br>	bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "");<span class="line"><!---->	bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "");<!----></span><br><br>	/* Dequeue all entries and run them */<span class="line"><!---->	/* Dequeue all entries and run them */<!----></span><br>	while (1) {<span class="line"><!---->	while (1) {<!----></span><br>		struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<span (entry->destroy)<span class="line"><!---->			if (entry-&gt;destroy)<!----></span><br>				entry->destroy(hdev, entry->data, err);<span class="line"><!---->				entry-&gt;destroy(hdev, entry-&gt;data, err);<!----></span><br>			hci_req_sync_unlock(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->			hci_req_sync_unlock(hdev);<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br><br>		kfree(entry);<span *hdev)<span class="line"><!---->void hci_cmd_sync_clear(struct hci_dev *hdev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry, *tmp;<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: kernel crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: kernel crash<!----></span><br>Crash State: please see the kasan.log<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: please see the kasan.log<!----></span><br><br>Ref Link:<span class="line"><!---->Ref Link:<!----></span><br>https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/06/08/2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/06/08/2"><!---->https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/06/08/2<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        So this is a race condition in kernel/bluetooth. From a quick glance, hci_cmd_sync_clear is used to reset everything. In practice no hci_cmd_sync_work will likely start before hci_sync_clear ends. Have you considered to raise this point to the v6.1 kernel maillist?<span class="line"><!---->So this is a race condition in kernel/bluetooth. From a quick glance, hci_cmd_sync_clear is used to reset everything. In practice no hci_cmd_sync_work will likely start before hci_sync_clear ends. Have you considered to raise this point to the v6.1 kernel maillist?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c"><!---->16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<!----></a><br>Author: Min Li <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Min Li &lt;<!----></span>lm0963hack@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lm0963hack@gmail.com"><!---->lm0963hack@gmail.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Mar 04 13:50:35 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Mar 04 13:50:35 2023<!----></span><br><br>FROMGIT: Bluetooth: Fix race condition in hci_cmd_sync_clear<span class="line"><!---->FROMGIT: Bluetooth: Fix race condition in hci_cmd_sync_clear<!----></span><br><br>There is a potential race condition in hci_cmd_sync_work and<span class="line"><!---->There is a potential race condition in hci_cmd_sync_work and<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. For instance,<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. For instance,<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<!----></span><br><br>Here's the call trace:<span class="line"><!---->Here's the call trace:<!----></span><br><br>dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x63<span cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<!----></span><br><br>Here's the call trace:<span class="line"><!---->Here's the call trace:<!----></span><br><br>dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x63<span For instance,<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. For instance,<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<!----></span><br><br>Here's the call trace:<span class="line"><!---->Here's the call trace:<!----></span><br><br>dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x63<span hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in For instance,<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<!----></span><br><br>Here's the call trace:<span class="line"><!---->Here's the call trace:<!----></span><br><br>dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x63<span         re #23<span class="line"><!---->re #23<!----></span><br><br>> were you actually able to exploit this bug on ChromeOS <span class="line"><!---->&gt; were you actually able to exploit this bug on ChromeOS <!----></span><br>No, I don't have a exp to get root shell via this bug.<span class="line"><!---->No, I don't have a exp to get root shell via this bug.<!----></span><br><br>> given Chrome OS does not allow arbitrary code execution?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; given Chrome OS does not allow arbitrary code execution?<!----></span><br>According to the vrp page, this bug should be evaluated in developer mode to create proper starting conditions. It is a priviledge escape bug, not a remote code execution bug.<span class="line"><!---->According to the vrp page, this bug should be evaluated in developer mode to create proper starting conditions. It is a priviledge escape bug, not a remote code execution bug.<!----></span><br><br>"Reports that break individual layers without including a vector to trigger the bug via a web page or a malicious app may be evaluated in developer mode to create the appropriate starting condition."<span class="line"><!---->"Reports that break individual layers without including a vector to trigger the bug via a web page or a malicious app may be evaluated in developer mode to create the appropriate starting condition."<!----></span><br><br>> Your proof of concept requires CAP_NET_ADMIN and expands the time window in order to reproduce the bug.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Your proof of concept requires CAP_NET_ADMIN and expands the time window in order to reproduce the bug.<!----></span><br>The CAP_NET_ADMIN requirement may be satisfied by creating new namespace via unshare. The purpose of expanding the time window is to make it easier to reproduce the bug. In many race condition reports, the time window is manually expanded too, for example <span class="line"><!---->The CAP_NET_ADMIN requirement may be satisfied by creating new namespace via unshare. The purpose of expanding the time window is to make it easier to reproduce the bug. In many race condition reports, the time window is manually expanded too, for example <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/project-zero/issues/detail?id=2373<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/project-zero/issues/detail?id=2373"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/project-zero/issues/detail?id=2373<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The `msleep` for the PoC is a normal part of writing a PoC.<span class="line"><!---->The `msleep` for the PoC is a normal part of writing a PoC.<!----></span><br><br>Requiring CAP_NET_ADMIN for exploitation means that the bar to exploitation is on the high side; e.g. web renderer → priv esc to something with the ability to call `unshare`, or otherwise get CAP_NET_ADMIN → kernel via this bug. (I don't think you can call `unshare` in a renderer, but I could be wrong.)<span class="line"><!---->Requiring CAP_NET_ADMIN for exploitation means that the bar to exploitation is on the high side; e.g. web renderer → priv esc to something with the ability to call `unshare`, or otherwise get CAP_NET_ADMIN → kernel via this bug. (I don't think you can call `unshare` in a renderer, but I could be wrong.)<!----></span><br><br>As discussed in other bugs of this type, that is a legitimate attack path but is high-cost. I suggest Medium as the ceiling for severity, but it could be Low if the middle step is relatively easy to achieve.<span class="line"><!---->As discussed in other bugs of this type, that is a legitimate attack path but is high-cost. I suggest Medium as the ceiling for severity, but it could be Low if the middle step is relatively easy to achieve.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.         <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>The root cause of this issue is similar to <span class="line"><!---->The root cause of this issue is similar to <!----></span>issue 1355718<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1355718" title="Security: UAF in hci_cmd_timeout "><!---->issue 1355718<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>race condition UAF.<span class="line"><!---->race condition UAF.<!----></span><br><br>*hci_cmd_sync_queue* will check the flag of hdev not equal to *HCI_UNREGISTER*[1], and enqueue *hdev->cmd_sync_work*(which is *hci_cmd_sync_work*)[2]. *hci_cmd_sync_work* will get entry[3] from *hdev->cmd_sync_work_list*, and remove it from *hdev->cmd_sync_work_list* under *hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock*. But *hci_cmd_sync_clear* get entry from *hdev->cmd_sync_work_list* and delete it[4] without any lock. There will be a race condition between *hci_cmd_sync_work* and *hci_cmd_sync_clear*.<span class="line"><!---->*hci_cmd_sync_queue* will check the flag of hdev not equal to *HCI_UNREGISTER*[1], and enqueue *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work*(which is *hci_cmd_sync_work*)[2]. *hci_cmd_sync_work* will get entry[3] from *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list*, and remove it from *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list* under *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock*. But *hci_cmd_sync_clear* get entry from *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list* and delete it[4] without any lock. There will be a race condition between *hci_cmd_sync_work* and *hci_cmd_sync_clear*.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>int hci_cmd_sync_queue(struct hci_dev *hdev, hci_cmd_sync_work_func_t func,<span class="line"><!---->int hci_cmd_sync_queue(struct hci_dev *hdev, hci_cmd_sync_work_func_t func,<!----></span><br>		       void *data, hci_cmd_sync_work_destroy_t destroy)<span class="line"><!---->		       void *data, hci_cmd_sync_work_destroy_t destroy)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<!----></span><br><br>	if (hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER))	// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER))	// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -ENODEV;<span class="line"><!---->		return -ENODEV;<!----></span><br><br>	entry = kmalloc(sizeof(*entry), GFP_KERNEL);<span class="line"><!---->	entry = kmalloc(sizeof(*entry), GFP_KERNEL);<!----></span><br>	if (!entry)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!entry)<!----></span><br>		return -ENOMEM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -ENOMEM;<!----></span><br><br>	entry->func = func;<span class="line"><!---->	entry-&gt;func = func;<!----></span><br>	entry->data = data;<span class="line"><!---->	entry-&gt;data = data;<!----></span><br>	entry->destroy = destroy;<span class="line"><!---->	entry-&gt;destroy = destroy;<!----></span><br><br>	mutex_lock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->	mutex_lock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br>	list_add_tail(&entry->list, &hdev->cmd_sync_work_list);<span class="line"><!---->	list_add_tail(&amp;entry-&gt;list, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list);<!----></span><br>	mutex_unlock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->	mutex_unlock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br><br>	queue_work(hdev->req_workqueue, &hdev->cmd_sync_work);	// [2]<span class="line"><!---->	queue_work(hdev-&gt;req_workqueue, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work);	// [2]<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>static void hci_cmd_sync_work(struct work_struct *work)<span class="line"><!---->static void hci_cmd_sync_work(struct work_struct *work)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev, cmd_sync_work);<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev, cmd_sync_work);<!----></span><br><br>	bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "");<span class="line"><!---->	bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "");<!----></span><br><br>	/* Dequeue all entries and run them */<span class="line"><!---->	/* Dequeue all entries and run them */<!----></span><br>	while (1) {<span class="line"><!---->	while (1) {<!----></span><br>		struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<span class="line"><!---->		struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<!----></span><br><br>		mutex_lock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->		mutex_lock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br>		entry = list_first_entry_or_null(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_list,		// [3]<span class="line"><!---->		entry = list_first_entry_or_null(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list,		// [3]<!----></span><br>						 struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry,<span class="line"><!---->						 struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry,<!----></span><br>						 list);<span class="line"><!---->						 list);<!----></span><br>		if (entry)<span class="line"><!---->		if (entry)<!----></span><br>			list_del(&entry->list);<span class="line"><!---->			list_del(&amp;entry-&gt;list);<!----></span><br>		mutex_unlock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->		mutex_unlock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br><br>		if (!entry)<span class="line"><!---->		if (!entry)<!----></span><br>			break;<span class="line"><!---->			break;<!----></span><br><br>		bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "entry %p", entry);<span class="line"><!---->		bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "entry %p", entry);<!----></span><br><br>		if (entry->func) {<span class="line"><!---->		if (entry-&gt;func) {<!----></span><br>			int err;<span class="line"><!---->			int err;<!----></span><br><br>			hci_req_sync_lock(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->			hci_req_sync_lock(hdev);<!----></span><br>			err = entry->func(hdev, entry->data);<span class="line"><!---->			err = entry-&gt;func(hdev, entry-&gt;data);<!----></span><br>			if (entry->destroy)<span class="line"><!---->			if (entry-&gt;destroy)<!----></span><br>				entry->destroy(hdev, entry->data, err);<span class="line"><!---->				entry-&gt;destroy(hdev, entry-&gt;data, err);<!----></span><br>			hci_req_sync_unlock(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->			hci_req_sync_unlock(hdev);<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br><br>		kfree(entry);<span class="line"><!---->		kfree(entry);<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void hci_cmd_sync_clear(struct hci_dev *hdev)<span class="line"><!---->void hci_cmd_sync_clear(struct hci_dev *hdev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry, *tmp;<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry, *tmp;<!----></span><br><br>	cancel_work_sync(&hdev->cmd_sync_work);<span class="line"><!---->	cancel_work_sync(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work);<!----></span><br>	cancel_work_sync(&hdev->reenable_adv_work);<span class="line"><!---->	cancel_work_sync(&amp;hdev-&gt;reenable_adv_work);<!----></span><br><br>	list_for_each_entry_safe(entry, tmp, &hdev->cmd_sync_work_list, list) {<span class="line"><!---->	list_for_each_entry_safe(entry, tmp, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list, list) {<!----></span><br>		if (entry->destroy)<span class="line"><!---->		if (entry-&gt;destroy)<!----></span><br>			entry->destroy(hdev, entry->data, -ECANCELED);<span class="line"><!---->			entry-&gt;destroy(hdev, entry-&gt;data, -ECANCELED);<!----></span><br><br>		list_del(&entry->list);<span class="line"><!---->		list_del(&amp;entry-&gt;list);<!----></span><br>		kfree(entry);		// [4]<span class="line"><!---->		kfree(entry);		// [4]<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>hci_cmd_sync_queue									|		hci_unregister_dev<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_queue									|		hci_unregister_dev<!----></span><br>	hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER) [1]		|<span class="line"><!---->	hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER) [1]		|<!----></span><br>													|			hci_dev_set_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER)<span class="line"><!---->													|			hci_dev_set_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER)<!----></span><br>													|				hci_cmd_sync_clear<span class="line"><!---->													|				hci_cmd_sync_clear<!----></span><br>													|					cancel_work_sync(&hdev->cmd_sync_work)<span class="line"><!---->													|					cancel_work_sync(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work)<!----></span><br>		queue_work[2]								|				<span class="line"><!---->		queue_work[2]								|				<!----></span><br>			hci_cmd_sync_work						|<span class="line"><!---->			hci_cmd_sync_work						|<!----></span><br>				list_first_entry_or_null [3]		|<span class="line"><!---->				list_first_entry_or_null [3]		|<!----></span><br>													|						kfree(entry) [4]<span class="line"><!---->													|						kfree(entry) [4]<!----></span><br>					list_del(&entry->list) <--- UAF<span class="line"><!---->					list_del(&amp;entry-&gt;list) &lt;--- UAF<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>The time window is very small, please apply the patch which just expands the time window.<span class="line"><!---->The time window is very small, please apply the patch which just expands the time window.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c b/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c b/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c<!----></span><br>index 2337a1c4827d..60f961ebcfeb 100644<span class="line"><!---->@@ -288,6 +288,7 @@ static void hci_cmd_sync_work(struct work_struct *work)<!----></span><br>                entry = list_first_entry_or_null(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_list,<span class="line"><!---->                entry = list_first_entry_or_null(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list,<!----></span><br>                                                 struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry,<span class="line"><!---->                                                 struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry,<!----></span><br>                                                 list);<span class="line"><!---->                                                 list);<!----></span><br>+               msleep(20);<span class="line"><!---->+                      list_del(&amp;entry-&gt;list);<!----></span><br>                mutex_unlock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->                mutex_unlock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br>@@ -642,7 +643,7 @@ void hci_cmd_sync_clear(struct hci_dev *hdev)<span class="line"><!---->@@ -642,7 +643,7 @@ void      list_for_each_entry_safe(entry, tmp, &hdev->cmd_sync_work_list, list) {<span class="line"><!---->        list_for_each_entry_safe(entry, tmp, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list, list) {<!----></span><br>                if (entry->destroy)<span class="line"><!---->                if (entry-&gt;destroy)<!----></span><br>                        entry->destroy(hdev, entry->data, 0;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>1. Compile the poc.<span class="line"><!---->1. Compile the poc.<!----></span><br>2. Run poc in ChromiumOS system. It needs CAP_NET_ADMIN privilege.<span class="line"><!---->2. Run poc in ChromiumOS system. It needs CAP_NET_ADMIN privilege.<!----></span><br><br>FIX PATCH SUGGESTION<span class="line"><!---->FIX PATCH SUGGESTION<!----></span><br>I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<span class="line"><!---->I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c         by

        So this is a race condition in kernel/bluetooth. From a quick glance, hci_cmd_sync_clear is used to reset everything. In practice no hci_cmd_sync_work will likely start before hci_sync_clear ends. Have you considered to raise this point to the v6.1 kernel maillist?<span class="line"><!---->So this is a race condition in kernel/bluetooth. From a quick glance, hci_cmd_sync_clear is used to reset everything. In practice no hci_cmd_sync_work will likely start before hci_sync_clear ends. Have you considered to raise this point to the v6.1 kernel maillist?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c"><!---->16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<!----></a><br>Author: Min Li <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Min Li &lt;<!----></span>lm0963hack@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lm0963hack@gmail.com"><!---->lm0963hack@gmail.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Mar 04 13:50:35 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Mar 04 13:50:35 2023<!----></span><br><br>FROMGIT: Bluetooth: Fix race condition in hci_cmd_sync_clear<span class="line"><!---->FROMGIT: Bluetooth: Fix race condition in hci_cmd_sync_clear<!----></span><br><br>There is a potential race condition in hci_cmd_sync_work and<span class="line"><!---->There is a potential race condition in hci_cmd_sync_work and<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. For instance,<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. For instance,<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<!----></span><br><br>Here's the call trace:<span class="line"><!---->Here's the call trace:<!----></span><br><br>dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x63<span For instance,<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. For instance,<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<!----></span><br><br>Here's the call trace:<span class="line"><!---->Here's the call trace:<!----></span><br><br>dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x63<span         re #23<span class="line"><!---->re #23<!----></span><br><br>> were you actually able to exploit this bug on ChromeOS <span class="line"><!---->&gt; were you actually able to exploit this bug on ChromeOS <!----></span><br>No, I don't have a exp to get root shell via this bug.<span class="line"><!---->No, I don't have a exp to get root shell via this bug.<!----></span><br><br>> given Chrome OS does not allow arbitrary code execution?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; given Chrome OS does not allow arbitrary code execution?<!----></span><br>According to the vrp page, this bug should be evaluated in developer mode to create proper starting conditions. It is a priviledge escape bug, not a remote code execution bug.<span class="line"><!---->According to the vrp page, this bug should be evaluated in developer mode to create proper starting conditions. It is a priviledge escape bug, not a remote code execution bug.<!----></span><br><br>"Reports that break individual layers without including a vector to trigger the bug via a web page or a malicious app may be evaluated in developer mode to create the appropriate starting condition."<span class="line"><!---->"Reports that break individual layers without including a vector to trigger the bug via a web page or a malicious app may be evaluated in developer mode to create the appropriate starting condition."<!----></span><br><br>> Your proof of concept requires CAP_NET_ADMIN and expands the time window in order to reproduce the bug.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Your proof of concept requires CAP_NET_ADMIN and expands the time window in order to reproduce the bug.<!----></span><br>The CAP_NET_ADMIN requirement may be satisfied by creating new namespace via unshare. The purpose of expanding the time window is to make it easier to reproduce the bug. In many race condition reports, the time window is manually expanded too, for example <span class="line"><!---->The CAP_NET_ADMIN requirement may be satisfied by creating new namespace via unshare. The purpose of expanding the time window is to make it easier to reproduce the bug. In many race condition reports, the time window is manually expanded too, for example <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/project-zero/issues/detail?id=2373<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/project-zero/issues/detail?id=2373"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/project-zero/issues/detail?id=2373<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The `msleep` for the PoC is a normal part of writing a PoC.<span class="line"><!---->The `msleep` for the PoC is a normal part of writing a PoC.<!----></span><br><br>Requiring CAP_NET_ADMIN for exploitation means that the bar to exploitation is on the high side; e.g. web renderer → priv esc to something with the ability to call `unshare`, or otherwise get CAP_NET_ADMIN → kernel via this bug. (I don't think you can call `unshare` in a renderer, but I could be wrong.)<span class="line"><!---->Requiring CAP_NET_ADMIN for exploitation means that the bar to exploitation is on the high side; e.g. web renderer → priv esc to something with the ability to call `unshare`, or otherwise get CAP_NET_ADMIN → kernel via this bug. (I don't think you can call `unshare` in a renderer, but I could be wrong.)<!----></span><br><br>As discussed in other bugs of this type, that is a legitimate attack path but is high-cost. I suggest Medium as the ceiling for severity, but it could be Low if the middle step is relatively easy to achieve.<span class="line"><!---->As discussed in other bugs of this type, that is a legitimate attack path but is high-cost. I suggest Medium as the ceiling for severity, but it could be Low if the middle step is relatively easy to achieve.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>The root cause of this issue is similar to <span class="line"><!---->The root cause of this issue is similar to <!----></span>issue 1355718<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1355718" title="Security: UAF in hci_cmd_timeout "><!---->issue 1355718<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>race condition UAF.<span class="line"><!---->race condition UAF.<!----></span><br><br>*hci_cmd_sync_queue* will check the flag of hdev not equal to *HCI_UNREGISTER*[1], and enqueue *hdev->cmd_sync_work*(which is *hci_cmd_sync_work*)[2]. *hci_cmd_sync_work* will get entry[3] from *hdev->cmd_sync_work_list*, and remove it from *hdev->cmd_sync_work_list* under *hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock*. But *hci_cmd_sync_clear* get entry from *hdev->cmd_sync_work_list* and delete it[4] without any lock. There will be a race condition between *hci_cmd_sync_work* and *hci_cmd_sync_clear*.<span class="line"><!---->*hci_cmd_sync_queue* will check the flag of hdev not equal to *HCI_UNREGISTER*[1], and enqueue *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work*(which is *hci_cmd_sync_work*)[2]. *hci_cmd_sync_work* will get entry[3] from *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list*, and remove it from *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list* under *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock*. But *hci_cmd_sync_clear* get entry from *hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list* and delete it[4] without any lock. There will be a race condition between *hci_cmd_sync_work* and *hci_cmd_sync_clear*.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>int hci_cmd_sync_queue(struct hci_dev *hdev, hci_cmd_sync_work_func_t func,<span class="line"><!---->int hci_cmd_sync_queue(struct hci_dev *hdev, hci_cmd_sync_work_func_t func,<!----></span><br>		       void *data, hci_cmd_sync_work_destroy_t destroy)<span class="line"><!---->		       void *data, hci_cmd_sync_work_destroy_t destroy)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<!----></span><br><br>	if (hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER))	// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER))	// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -ENODEV;<span class="line"><!---->		return -ENODEV;<!----></span><br><br>	entry = kmalloc(sizeof(*entry), GFP_KERNEL);<span class="line"><!---->	entry = kmalloc(sizeof(*entry), GFP_KERNEL);<!----></span><br>	if (!entry)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!entry)<!----></span><br>		return -ENOMEM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -ENOMEM;<!----></span><br><br>	entry->func = func;<span class="line"><!---->	entry-&gt;func = func;<!----></span><br>	entry->data = data;<span class="line"><!---->	entry-&gt;data = data;<!----></span><br>	entry->destroy = destroy;<span class="line"><!---->	entry-&gt;destroy = destroy;<!----></span><br><br>	mutex_lock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->	mutex_lock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br>	list_add_tail(&entry->list, &hdev->cmd_sync_work_list);<span class="line"><!---->	list_add_tail(&amp;entry-&gt;list, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list);<!----></span><br>	mutex_unlock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->	mutex_unlock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br><br>	queue_work(hdev->req_workqueue, &hdev->cmd_sync_work);	// [2]<span class="line"><!---->	queue_work(hdev-&gt;req_workqueue, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work);	// [2]<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>static void hci_cmd_sync_work(struct work_struct *work)<span class="line"><!---->static void hci_cmd_sync_work(struct work_struct *work)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev, cmd_sync_work);<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_dev *hdev = container_of(work, struct hci_dev, cmd_sync_work);<!----></span><br><br>	bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "");<span class="line"><!---->	bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "");<!----></span><br><br>	/* Dequeue all entries and run them */<span class="line"><!---->	/* Dequeue all entries and run them */<!----></span><br>	while (1) {<span class="line"><!---->	while (1) {<!----></span><br>		struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<span class="line"><!---->		struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry;<!----></span><br><br>		mutex_lock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->		mutex_lock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br>		entry = list_first_entry_or_null(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_list,		// [3]<span class="line"><!---->		entry = list_first_entry_or_null(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list,		// [3]<!----></span><br>						 struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry,<span class="line"><!---->						 struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry,<!----></span><br>						 list);<span class="line"><!---->						 list);<!----></span><br>		if (entry)<span class="line"><!---->		if (entry)<!----></span><br>			list_del(&entry->list);<span class="line"><!---->			list_del(&amp;entry-&gt;list);<!----></span><br>		mutex_unlock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!---->		mutex_unlock(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_lock);<!----></span><br><br>		if (!entry)<span class="line"><!---->		if (!entry)<!----></span><br>			break;<span class="line"><!---->			break;<!----></span><br><br>		bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "entry %p", entry);<span class="line"><!---->		bt_dev_dbg(hdev, "entry %p", entry);<!----></span><br><br>		if (entry->func) {<span class="line"><!---->		if (entry-&gt;func) {<!----></span><br>			int err;<span class="line"><!---->			int err;<!----></span><br><br>			hci_req_sync_lock(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->			hci_req_sync_lock(hdev);<!----></span><br>			err = entry->func(hdev, entry->data);<span class="line"><!---->			err = entry-&gt;func(hdev, entry-&gt;data);<!----></span><br>			if (entry->destroy)<span class="line"><!---->			if (entry-&gt;destroy)<!----></span><br>				entry->destroy(hdev, entry->data, err);<span class="line"><!---->				entry-&gt;destroy(hdev, entry-&gt;data, err);<!----></span><br>			hci_req_sync_unlock(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->			hci_req_sync_unlock(hdev);<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br><br>		kfree(entry);<span class="line"><!---->		kfree(entry);<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void hci_cmd_sync_clear(struct hci_dev *hdev)<span class="line"><!---->void hci_cmd_sync_clear(struct hci_dev *hdev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry, *tmp;<span class="line"><!---->	struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry *entry, *tmp;<!----></span><br><br>	cancel_work_sync(&hdev->cmd_sync_work);<span class="line"><!---->	cancel_work_sync(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work);<!----></span><br>	cancel_work_sync(&hdev->reenable_adv_work);<span class="line"><!---->	cancel_work_sync(&amp;hdev-&gt;reenable_adv_work);<!----></span><br><br>	list_for_each_entry_safe(entry, tmp, &hdev->cmd_sync_work_list, list) {<span class="line"><!---->	list_for_each_entry_safe(entry, tmp, &amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work_list, list) {<!----></span><br>		if (entry->destroy)<span class="line"><!---->		if (entry-&gt;destroy)<!----></span><br>			entry->destroy(hdev, entry->data, -ECANCELED);<span class="line"><!---->			entry-&gt;destroy(hdev, entry-&gt;data, -ECANCELED);<!----></span><br><br>		list_del(&entry->list);<span class="line"><!---->		list_del(&amp;entry-&gt;list);<!----></span><br>		kfree(entry);		// [4]<span class="line"><!---->		kfree(entry);		// [4]<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>hci_cmd_sync_queue									|		hci_unregister_dev<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_queue									|		hci_unregister_dev<!----></span><br>	hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER) [1]		|<span class="line"><!---->	hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER) [1]		|<!----></span><br>													|			hci_dev_set_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER)<span class="line"><!---->													|			hci_dev_set_flag(hdev, HCI_UNREGISTER)<!----></span><br>													|				hci_cmd_sync_clear<span class="line"><!---->													|				hci_cmd_sync_clear<!----></span><br>													|					cancel_work_sync(&hdev->cmd_sync_work)<span class="line"><!---->													|					cancel_work_sync(&amp;hdev-&gt;cmd_sync_work)<!----></span><br>		queue_work[2]								|				<span class="line"><!---->		queue_work[2]								|				<!----></span><br>			hci_cmd_sync_work						|<span class="line"><!---->			hci_cmd_sync_work						|<!----></span><br>				list_first_entry_or_null [3]		|<span class="line"><!---->				list_first_entry_or_null [3]		|<!----></span><br>													|						kfree(entry) [4]<span class="line"><!---->													|						kfree(entry) [4]<!----></span><br>					list_del(&entry->list) <--- UAF<span class="line"><!---->					list_del(&amp;entry-&gt;list) &lt;--- UAF<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Operating System: ChromiumOS Kernel 6.1 stable + dev<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: ChromiumOS Kernel 6.1 stable + dev<!----></span><br><br>Bisect:<span class="line"><!---->Bisect:<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/_/chromium/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/6a98e3836fa2077b169f10a35c2ca9952d53f987<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/_/chromium/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/6a98e3836fa2077b169f10a35c2ca9952d53f987"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/_/chromium/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/6a98e3836fa2077b169f10a35c2ca9952d53f987<!----></a><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>The time window is very small, please apply the patch which just expands the time window.<span class="line"><!---->The time window is very small, please apply the patch which just expands the time window.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c b/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c b/net/bluetooth/hci_sync.c<!----></span><br>index 2337a1c4827d..60f961ebcfeb 100644<span hci_cmd_sync_work_entry,<span class="line"><!---->                                                 struct hci_cmd_sync_work_entry,<!----></span><br>                      list_del(&amp;entry-&gt;list);<!----></span><br>                mutex_unlock(&hdev->cmd_sync_work_lock);<span class="line"><!----> 0;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>1. Compile the poc.<span class="line"><!---->1. Compile the poc.<!----></span><br>2. Run poc in ChromiumOS system. It needs CAP_NET_ADMIN privilege.<span class="line"><!---->2. Run poc in ChromiumOS system. It needs CAP_NET_ADMIN privilege.<!----></span><br><br>FIX PATCH SUGGESTION<span class="line"><!---->FIX PATCH SUGGESTION<!----></span><br>I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<span         by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1413031#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Feb 9, 2023, 4:09 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          groeck@google.com alain...@google.com
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          groeck@google.com alain...@google.com
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        So this is a race condition in kernel/bluetooth. From a quick glance, hci_cmd_sync_clear is used to reset everything. In practice no hci_cmd_sync_work will likely start before hci_sync_clear ends. Have you considered to raise this point to the v6.1 kernel maillist?<span class="line"><!---->So this is a race condition in kernel/bluetooth. From a quick glance, hci_cmd_sync_clear is used to reset everything. In practice no hci_cmd_sync_work will likely start before hci_sync_clear ends. Have you considered to raise this point to the v6.1 kernel maillist?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c"><!---->16cd89427273230c51046c4696d231a9d460c18c<!----></a><br>Author: Min Li <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Min Li &lt;<!----></span>lm0963hack@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lm0963hack@gmail.com"><!---->lm0963hack@gmail.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Mar 04 13:50:35 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Mar 04 13:50:35 2023<!----></span><br><br>FROMGIT: Bluetooth: Fix race condition in hci_cmd_sync_clear<span class="line"><!---->FROMGIT: Bluetooth: Fix race condition in hci_cmd_sync_clear<!----></span><br><br>There is a potential race condition in hci_cmd_sync_work and<span class="line"><!---->There is a potential race condition in hci_cmd_sync_work and<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. For instance,<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. For instance,<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<!----></span><br><br>Here's the call trace:<span class="line"><!---->Here's the call trace:<!----></span><br><br>dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x63<span class="line"><!---->dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x63<!----></span><br>print_report.cold+0x5e/0x5d3<span class="line"><!---->print_report.cold+0x5e/0x5d3<!----></span><br>? hci_cmd_sync_work+0x282/0x320<span class="line"><!---->? hci_cmd_sync_work+0x282/0x320<!----></span><br>kasan_report+0xaa/0x120<span class="line"><!---->kasan_report+0xaa/0x120<!----></span><br>? hci_cmd_sync_work+0x282/0x320<span class="line"><!---->? hci_cmd_sync_work+0x282/0x320<!----></span><br>__asan_report_load8_noabort+0x14/0x20<span class="line"><!---->__asan_report_load8_noabort+0x14/0x20<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_work+0x282/0x320<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_work+0x282/0x320<!----></span><br>process_one_work+0x77b/0x11c0<span class="line"><!---->process_one_work+0x77b/0x11c0<!----></span><br>? For instance,<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. For instance,<!----></span><br>hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_work is added to the 'req_workqueue' after cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in For instance,<span class="line"><!---->hci_cmd_sync_clear, and could lead to use-after-free. cancel_work_sync<!----></span><br>The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<span class="line"><!---->The entry of 'cmd_sync_work_list' may be freed in hci_cmd_sync_clear, and<!----></span><br>causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<span class="line"><!---->causing kernel panic when it is used in 'hci_cmd_sync_work'.<!----></span><br><br>Here's the call trace:<span class="line"><!---->Here's the call trace:<!----></span><br><br>dump_stack_lvl+0x49/0x63<span
